name: Arman Rahman
bio: Arman Rahman is a talented Bangladeshi chef who has been cooking for over 12 years. He specializes in fusion cuisine, combining traditional Bangladeshi ingredients and flavors with international cooking techniques.

recipes.name: Beef Bhuna
recipes.ingredients: beef, onion, ginger paste, garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, salt, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan and fry the onion until golden brown. Add beef, ginger paste, garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, and salt. Cook until the beef is tender and the spices are well blended.

recipes.name: Shorshe Bata Ilish
recipes.ingredients: ilish fish, mustard paste, turmeric, salt, green chili, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Rub the fish with turmeric and salt. Heat oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown. In another pan, mix the mustard paste with water and cook until the mixture thickens. Add green chili and pour the mixture over the fish.

recipes.name: Aloo Posto
recipes.ingredients: potato, poppy seeds, mustard oil, green chili, salt
recipes.cooking_method: Boil potatoes until tender. In another pan, fry the poppy seeds until fragrant. Grind the poppy seeds into a paste and mix with mustard oil. Add the potatoes, green chili, and salt. Cook until the flavors are well combined.

name: Mohammad Ali
bio: Mohammad Ali is a highly respected Bangladeshi chef with over 15 years of experience. He is a master of traditional Bengali cuisine and is known for his ability to create complex and nuanced flavors.

recipes.name: Chicken Curry
recipes.ingredients: chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin, garam masala, salt, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan and fry the onion, garlic, and ginger until golden brown. Add chicken, turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the chicken is tender and the spices are well blended.

recipes.name: Mutton Rezala
recipes.ingredients: mutton, onion, ginger paste, garlic paste, yogurt, poppy seeds, cashew nuts, chili powder, garam masala, salt, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan and fry the onion until golden brown. Add mutton, ginger paste, garlic paste, yogurt, poppy seeds, cashew nuts, chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the mutton is tender and the spices are well blended.

recipes.name: Aloo Posto
recipes.ingredients: potato, poppy seeds, mustard oil, green chili, salt
recipes.cooking_method: Boil potatoes until tender. In another pan, fry the poppy seeds until fragrant. Grind the poppy seeds into a paste and mix with mustard oil. Add the potatoes, green chili, and salt. Cook until the flavors are well combined.

name: Sadia Islam Mou
bio: Sadia Islam Mou is a renowned Bangladeshi chef who has been in the industry for over 10 years. She is known for her expertise in traditional Bengali cuisine and has won several awards for her innovative and delicious dishes.

recipes.name: Chingri Bhapa
recipes.ingredients: prawns, coconut milk, mustard seeds, green chillies, turmeric powder, salt
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Clean and devein the prawns. 2. Mix the prawns with coconut milk, mustard seeds, green chillies, turmeric powder, and salt. 3. Put the mixture in a steamer and steam for 10-15 minutes. 4. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
recipes.ingredients: hilsa fish, mustard oil, black mustard seeds, turmeric powder, salt, green chillies
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Clean and cut the hilsa fish into pieces. 2. Mix the fish with mustard oil, black mustard seeds, turmeric powder, salt, and green chillies. 3. Cook the mixture on a low flame for 10-15 minutes. 4. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Beef Bhuna
recipes.ingredients: beef, onion, garlic, ginger, red chilli powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, oil
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Cut the beef into small pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. 3. Add garlic, ginger, red chilli powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Fry for 2-3 minutes. 4. Add the beef and cook for 10-15 minutes on medium heat until the beef is tender. 5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Nafiz Rahman
bio: Nafiz Rahman is a versatile Bangladeshi chef with a wide range of culinary skills. He has worked in some of the top restaurants in Bangladesh and is known for his ability to create both traditional and modern dishes.
